page.title: 01Henwood and its surroundings
page.content: The western half is moor, the eastern rough grazing and intensive grassland. Livestock farming is the main industry: Kingbeare-Botternell, a tenanted intensive mixed farm owned by the Duchy of Cornwall;Newlands-Knowle, privately owned intensive dairy; Upton Hall and Darley, traditional family owned and worked. Mr. Budge of Kingbear and tenants of Wardbrook supplement rough pasture with rights to moor grazing. Subdivided former farms give holdings for ponies or 'hobby' flocks of sheep, goats, geese, etc. A blacksmith and coach-hire firm work in Darley Ford, electrician in Henwood, joiner in Westerlands, granite mason from Bearah Quarry, rough stone is removed from Notter.There is a group of musicians/writers.
